channel.title: Islamists' ban music on the radio
channel.description:
[b]Somali radio stations comply with Islamists' music ban[/b] Most radio stations in Somalia have stopped playing music, on the orders of Islamist Hizbul-Islam insurgents who say that songs are un-Islamic. The stations said they had to comply with the ban as if they did not, they would be putting their lives at risk. The BBC correspondent in Somalia says this latest order has strong echoes of the Taliban in Afghanistan. In the past, militants in some areas have banned watching films and football and forced men to grow beards. "We are using other sounds such as gunfire, the noise of the vehicles and birds to link up our programmes and news" Tusmo radio's Abdulahi Yasin Jama
http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/africa/8617627.stm Religion of peace, tolerance and freedom :) I predict this will happen in Gaza too.

item.title: Islamists' ban music on the radio
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

More bile to be thrown on the irrational.

nytimes.com

Militants Ban School Bells in a Town in Somalia

School principals were informed that the bells sounded like church bells and conflicted with the militants’ interpretation of Islam.

MOGADISHU, Somalia — The Shabab, Somalia’s most powerful Islamist insurgent group, outlawed school bells in a southern town on Thursday after deciding that they conflicted with Islam, residents said.
The Shabab also outlawed the observance of internationally recognized days like World AIDS Day, saying that only Islamic festivals could be recognized.

Read full topic

item.title: Islamists' ban music on the radio
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:8, topic:336721”][quote author=MujaheD link=topic=433131.msg3179472#msg3179472 date=1271189778]
oh no they can’t listen to tupac anymore! Therefore their freedom is restricted and therefore we should invade their country.
[/quote]
Lol, im kicking my self in the face because i have too much stuff to do to start a debate again. :rolleyes:

What im wondering is why you maintain the mindset that we invaded for a pointless reason that you make sound more retarded by relating it to news anything irrelevant to the war in the middle east. :P[/quote]
Lol I’m just doing my part you know.

Lothy:

I’m with c|p. You’ve got to be attempting to pull someone’s leg, MujaheD, if you think telling people that they can’t have music isn’t a restriction of freedom.

I’m sure there are numerous laws, even in so-called democratic countries, that can be considered to restrict people’s freedom. However only when it happens in a third world country does the media ever hype it up to distort people’s impressions.

Read full topic

True, but there is a feeling of superiority to be found among Western people. They think Arabs are stupid, barbaric monkey’s.[/quote]really? nobody’s ever given me that impression before.

keep in mind that almost no one listens to the radio these days anyway…

item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“Teh Spede, post:15, topic:336721”][quote author=Tenen link=topic=433131.msg3180193#msg3180193 date=1271228269]
uhhm, this country is in Africa…
[/quote]Ummm… and your point is?[/quote]

AFRICA IS FULL OF NIGGERTS AND AYDES!

Yes, it’s a restriction of freedom. But this happens in many fundamentalist country’s, which includes that one country I for once won’t call by it’s name. There are religious people, and then there are religious nuts. Because authorities don’t have that much power in nations such as Somalia is the cause that the nuts can do something like this.

Besides that, there’s a lot of negative news about Muslims. Is this to even out the negative view of Catholics?
